verses.text: 迦南人聞風喪膽在約旦河西，亞摩利人的眾王和靠近海邊迦南人的眾王，聽見耶和華怎樣使約旦河的水在以色列人面前乾了，直到他們都過河去，他們都心裡驚怕，因以色列人的緣故，勇氣全失。

words.note: Lit. 'hear the wind, lose courage'. An idiom.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'all the kings'.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'all the kings'.
Often used with '因...的緣故' meaning 'because of...'.

verses.text: 以色列在吉甲行割禮那時，耶和華對約書亞說：「你要製造火石刀，第二次給以色列人行割禮。」

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'perform the rite of cutting'.
Refers to knives made of flint, used for circumcision.
Verb-object compound, 'perform the rite of cutting'.

verses.text: 約書亞就製造了火石刀，在包皮山那裡給以色列人行了割禮。

words.note: Refers to knives made of flint, used for circumcision.
Lit. 'foreskin hill', named after the circumcision site.
Means 'cutting ritual' or 'circumcision ritual'.

verses.text: 約書亞給以色列人行割禮的原因是這樣：所有從埃及出來的人民，就是所有能作戰的男丁，出埃及以後，都死在曠野的路上。

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'perform the rite of cutting'.

words.definition: was as follows, is like this

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'exit Egypt'.

words.definition: on the road, along the way

verses.text: 因為所有從埃及出來的人民都受過割禮；唯有從埃及出來以後，所有在曠野的路上出生的人民，都沒有受過割禮。

words.note: Means 'cutting ritual' or 'circumcision ritual'.

words.definition: on the road, along the way

words.note: Means 'cutting ritual' or 'circumcision ritual'.

verses.text: 以色列人在曠野走了四十年，直到全國的人，就是從埃及出來能作戰的男丁，都滅盡了，因為他們不聽耶和華的話；耶和華曾經向他們起誓，必不容許他們看見耶和華向他們列祖起誓要賜給我們的地，就是流奶與蜜的地。

words.note: A transliteration of 'Israel' with 'people'.
Refers to men capable of serving or working.
Emphasizes complete annihilation.
A phrase symbolizing a rich and abundant land.

verses.text: 他們的子孫，就是耶和華興起來代替他們的，約書亞給他們行了割禮；這些人是未受割禮的人，因為他們在路上沒有受過割禮。

words.note: Lit. 'not yet received'.

verses.text: 全國的人受了割禮之後，都住在營中自己的地方，直到痊愈。
耶和華對約書亞說：「我今日把埃及的恥辱從你們身上輥去了。」因此，那地方名叫吉甲（「吉甲」意即「輥」），直到今日。

words.note: Implies removal or cleansing.
Used to explain the meaning of a word or name.

verses.text: 以色列人守逾越節以色列人在吉甲安營；正月十四日晚上，他們在耶利哥的平原守逾越節。

words.note: A transliteration of 'Israel' with 'people'.
Commemorates the Israelites' exodus from Egypt.
A transliteration of 'Israel' with 'people'.
Refers to the first month of the lunar calendar or year.
Commemorates the Israelites' exodus from Egypt.

verses.text: 逾越節後次日，他們吃了那地的出產；就在那一天，吃了無酵餅和烘的穀物。

words.note: A major Jewish festival commemorating the Exodus.
Indicates completed action.

verses.text: 嗎哪停止降下他們吃了那地的出產之後，第二天嗎哪就停止降下；以色列人不再有嗎哪了；那一年他們卻吃迦南地的出產。

words.note: A miraculous food provided to the Israelites.
Lit. 'Israel people'.
Indicates a new situation or completion of action.

verses.text: 約書亞與耶和華軍隊的元帥約書亞走近耶利哥的時候，抬頭觀看，看見一個人站在他對面，手裡拿著拔出來的刀。約書亞走到他那裡，對他說：「你是我們的人，還是我們的仇敵呢？」

words.note: Indicates direction and result of pulling.
Softens the question, implies a choice.

verses.text: 那人回答：「不是的；我現在來是作耶和華軍隊的元帥。」約書亞就臉伏在地，向他下拜，對他說：「我主有甚麼事要吩咐僕人呢？」

words.note: Often used at the end of a declarative sentence.
The name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to a supreme military commander, often in ancient contexts.
Often used in formal or biblical contexts for bowing deeply.
To prostrate oneself in reverence or worship.
A respectful address, especially for God or a superior.
Often used in the Bible to refer to God's chosen people or prophets.

verses.text: 耶和華軍隊的元帥對約書亞說：「把你腳上的鞋脫下來，因為你站的地方是聖地。」約書亞就照著行了。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
Indicates direction of taking something off downwards.
Turns the preceding verb phrase into a noun phrase.
